articles.title: Drought has endangered wild horses across the southwest, but one organization is determined to help
articles.description: When a severe drought hit the Southwest, wild horses began to suffer as water and vegetation disappeared. Working throughout Arizona, volunteers for Salt River Wild Horse Management trekked several miles a day to feed and care for the beleaguered horses. Than…

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Growing concern for Maine’s lobsters as coastal waters heat up
articles.description: Lobster adds up to a billion dollars a year to Maine’s economy. The population has boomed in waters warmed by climate change, but experts warn that rising temperatures will eventually drive the tasty crustaceans away.

articles.title: Mom credits code word with saving daughter from kidnapping attempt

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Tension between Trump and Macron as world leaders gather in Paris for WWI anniversary
articles.description: The president is in Paris, meeting with world leaders to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I. He missed an event at an American cemetery after bad weather prevented him from traveling by helicopter, the White House said.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Inside the growing military operation at U.S.-Mexico border
articles.description: There are now more than 5,600 active duty troops spread across the southern border, most located in Texas. The military says the mission is mostly to provide logistical support for Customs and Border Protection.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Florida orders first statewide recount in history after razor-thin margins in first pass
articles.description: Officials ordered a recount of more than eight million ballots amid hotly contested races for the governor’s office and a senate seat.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: California community threatened by wildfire after mass shooting
articles.description: Thousand Oaks, California, still reeling after a gunman killed 12 people in a crowded bar, now faces a fast-moving wildfire that has forced thousands to evacuate.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Evacuations and destruction as deadly wildfires blaze in California
articles.description: Firefighters are battling multiple blazes across the state, as the so-called Camp Fire in the north has become the most destructive wildfire in California’s history.
